node.title: ‘The Mood Room’ Review: 1980s Anomie, California Style
node.description: In Big Dance Theater’s new work, premiering at BAM Fisher, Annie-B Parson melds her sensibility with that of the Conceptual artist Guy de Cointet.

node.title: ‘I Was Skeptical.’ How Sondheim Agreed to Change ‘Company.’
node.description: Days before he died, Stephen Sondheim and the director Marianne Elliott chatted about a Broadway revival of his 1970 musical. With a gender swap, it has a “different flavor,” he said.

node.title: A Top Official Says the Fed Will ‘Grapple’ With Faster Bond-Buying Taper
node.description: The president of the New York Federal Reserve said Omicron could prolong supply and demand mismatches, causing some inflation pressures to last.

node.title: Trump Tested Positive for Virus Days Before Debate, 2 Ex-Officials Say
node.description: The former president first received a positive coronavirus test days ahead of his first debate with Joseph R. Biden Jr., and then received a negative result, two former officials say.

node.title: Anti-Vaxxer Who Treated His COVID Infection With Bleach Ingredient Dies
node.description: Prominent Austrian anti-vaccination advocate Johann Biacsics had previously falsely claimed that chlorine dioxide products could be used to treat COVID-19.

node.title: Heartwarming Video Shows Dogs Rescued From Meat Slaughterhouse Receiving Care
node.description: "We are giving them all the time and love they need to heal," said Lola Webber from Humane Society International.

node.title: Russia Plans to Make 'Aggressive Moves' to Destabilize Ukraine, U.S. Official Warns
node.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said if Russia moves against Ukraine, the U.S. and NATO would respond with "a range of high-impact economic measures."

node.title: Incredible Video Shows Farmer Rescuing Sheep From Deep Snow After Storm
node.description: The U.K. farm described the rescue efforts over the weekend as a "whirlwind of emotions" after it was covered in a blanket of snow.

node.title: European Union President Suggests Countries Within Bloc Make COVID Vaccines Mandatory
node.description: A surge of cases has caused many member nations to again increase their restrictions and mask requirements. The EU's current vaccination rate is 66 percent.

node.title: CDC Orders Airlines to Turn Over Passenger Lists From African Flights Amid Omicron Spread
node.description: Passenger names, addresses and contact information are among the details covered by the CDC's directive.

node.title: 2 Cops Stabbed While Responding to Disturbance Call, Both Shoot Alleged Attacker
node.description: The two officers and the suspect in the Indianapolis incident are in stable condition and are expected to recover. Their names have not been released.

node.title: 'You Don't Belong Here': Woman and Son Call Police on Black Employee in Viral Video
node.description: "I filed a police report and will be pressing charges. The Karen had also called the police and conveniently left out the fact her son assaulted me," the caption of the employee's video read.

node.title: Internet Determines George Jetson Was Likely Conceived This Week in Viral Posts
node.description: Based on his understood birthday, the fictional character would have been born next year making him a "Gen Alpha."

node.title: Mom of 14-Year-Old Shot 18 Times Waiting for Bus Doesn't Care About 'Justice'
node.description: Desiree Goodson said, "I just want my son back," after 14-year-old Samir Jefferson was fatally shot 18 times waiting for the bus after school.

node.title: Charlie Baker Exiting 2022 Race Gives Democrats 'Remarkable Chance' at Mass. Governorship
node.description: "There's not an obvious Republican with statewide prominence who could step up and fill those shoes at this time," a political science professor told Newsweek.

node.title: IOC defends call to Chinese tennis star
node.description: Senior International Olympic Committee member Dick Pound denies the organisation vouched for the safety of Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai to avoid angering 2022 Winter Olympic host Beijing.

node.title: Football Ferns end 2021 on a high
node.description: The Football Ferns have beaten South Korea 2-0 in their second international in Goyang.

node.title: It's going to be a hot and sticky summer - Niwa
node.description: It's looking to be a hotter than usual summer, with above average temperatures very likely across the motu.

node.title: Evidence in the Amy Mullis corn rake murder case
node.description: A look inside the case against Todd Mullis, a Iowa farmer accused of killing his wife with a farm tool.

node.title: Tucson police officer fired after fatally shooting a 61-year-old in a mobility scooter
node.description: The case is now under investigation by the Pima County Attorney's Office.

node.title: Why isn’t the Ghislaine Maxwell trial being televised?
node.description: Unlike other high-profile trials in recent months, Ms. Maxwell is being tried in federal court, where cameras are prohibited.

node.title: An Integration Plan Leads a Student to a New School: ‘His Whole Life Changed’
node.description: About 33 percent of public school students in Minneapolis were assigned to new schools this year. Here is the story of one family.

node.title: China Tells Citizens to Leave Part of Congo After Kidnappings, Increase in Violence
node.description: The Chinese Embassy in Kinshasa recommended that citizens in the districts of Bunia, Djugu, Beni, Rutshuru, Fizi, Uvira and Mwenga leave immediately.

node.title: Chief Justice Roberts Seeks Path to Allow Mississippi Abortion Ban Without Overturning Roe
node.description: Roberts suggested he would be ready to rule on fetal viability while upholding other abortion rights.

node.title: School Closes After Officers, Nurse Exposed to Fentanyl From Student's Vape Pen
node.description: The three people exposed to the drug were taken to a local hospital and are said to be in stable condition.

node.title: FedEx Packages Dumped in Alabama Ravine At Least 6 Times, Driver Fired From Job
node.description: The identity of the FedEx driver accused of dumping up to 400 packages in an Alabama ravine has not been released.

node.title: Capital One ends overdraft fees for customers
node.description: The move comes as regulators threaten to crack down on banks that rely too heavily on such penalties for revenue.

node.title: The Best Charcuterie Board
node.description: If you have any energy left, this midweek spread is worth it.

node.title: Substack Expands Food Newsletters With Ruth Reichl and Others
node.description: The former restaurant critic and Gourmet editor is joining a cadre of chefs and authors enlisted to expand the platform’s culinary content.

node.title: Baseball’s Paradox: Money Is Flowing on the Brink of a Shutdown
node.description: Players are agreeing to huge contracts, and even struggling teams are getting in on the action. With a lockout looming, recalibration may be preferable to reinvention.
